
### Rearrange the terms...  
$$ E(S ) > S  - a_.95 \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad S <E(S )+a_.95$$
and 
$$ E(S ) < S  +b_.95 \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad S >E(S )-b_.95$$
So, 
$$E(S ) \in (S  - a_.95,S + b_.95) \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad S  \in (E(S ) - b_.95,E(S )+ a_.95).$$
This implies that 
$$P\left(E(S ) \in (S  - a_.95,S + b_.95)\right) = P\left(S  \in (E(S ) - b_.95,E(S )+ a_.95)\right).$$
